items.title: Trump Calls Ukraine Ungrateful, Again, for U.S. Support in War With Russia
items.summary: President Trump renewed his criticism of Ukraine’s government as emissaries from Kyiv and Washington met to discuss a plan to end the war.

items.title: As Trump’s Inquisitors Face Scrutiny, a Divisive Figure Could Play a New Role
items.summary: The prosecutor running an inquiry into those who investigated President Trump has established a grand jury under Judge Aileen M. Cannon, whose scuttling of the documents case made her a White House favorite.

items.title: Rubio Insists U.S. Authored the Ukraine Peace Plan
items.summary: The comment from Secretary of State Marco Rubio came after a group of U.S. lawmakers claimed that he said the plan was a Russian initiative, not a U.S. proposal.

items.title: At Harvard-Yale Game, Rivals Come Together Against Trump Administration Attacks
items.summary: Students and alumni set aside rivalries at the 141st Harvard-Yale football game on Saturday to summon support against attacks on higher education under the Trump administration.

items.title: Fact-Checking Trump’s Latest Claims on Affordability
items.summary: The president has made misleading statements about the cost of a Thanksgiving meal, breakfast and gasoline and about prices in general.

items.title: F.B.I. Letters Send Shivers Through California’s Political Inner Circle
items.summary: The indictment of Gov. Gavin Newsom’s former chief of staff shocked many power players in California. Now, some wonder how far the investigation will spread.

items.title: Many prominent Maga personalities on X are based outside US, new tool reveals
items.summary: <p>Users posing as rightwing Americans are operating internationally, per the platform’s transparency feature</p><p>Many of the most influential personalities in the “Make America great again” (Maga) movement on <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/technology/twitter">X</a> are based outside of the US, including Russia, Nigeria and India, a new transparency feature on the social media site has revealed.</p><p>The new tool, called “about this account,” became available on Friday to users of the <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/technology/elon-musk">Elon Musk</a>-owned platform. It allows anyone to see where an account is located, when it joined the platform, how often its username has been changed, and how the X app was downloaded.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/23/rightwing-influencers-outside-us-x-twitter-tool">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: ‘That doesn’t exist’: Doge reportedly quietly disbanded ahead of schedule
items.summary: <p>Statement by Trump administration confirms longstanding suspicions that Musk-led agency is on its way out</p><p>The “department of government efficiency” (Doge) has apparently been dissolved with eight months still remaining on its contract, ending a drawn-out campaign of invading federal agencies and firing thousands of federal workers.</p><p>“That doesn’t exist,” office of personnel management (OPM) director Scott Kupor told <a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/us/doge-doesnt-exist-with-eight-months-left-its-charter-2025-11-23/https://www.reuters.com/world/us/doge-doesnt-exist-with-eight-months-left-its-charter-2025-11-23/">Reuters</a> earlier this month when asked about Doge’s status, adding that it was no longer a “centralized entity”.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/23/trump-musk-doge-reportedly-disbanded">Continue reading...</a>
